content: 12in 17-22 3x 12-15in sleeves make a slip knot on your hook and insert your hook into the bottom of the arm hole where you just finished sewing row 1 single_crochet around the arm hole it does not need to be a number divisible by 3 row 2 slip_stitch in the first 3 stitches chain 3 then skip 2 stitches and double_crochet in the 3rd stitch chain 1 double_crochet in the same stitch skip 2 stitches and double_crochet in the third stitch chain 1 double_crochet in the same stitch repeat for the entire row when you don t have enough stitches left to continue simply double_crochet in the next stitch and leave the last stitch alone *for example if you have 5 stitches left double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in the 3rd stitch then double_crochet once in the 4th stitch and skip the last stitch remaining then chain 3 and turn your work row 2 in every even numbered row we will have double_crochet clusters where we will double_crochet 5 in every other space rather than double_crochet 2 vs we will also be decreasing to give a cap sleeve look so skip the first ch1 space and double_crochet in the next chain 1 space chain 1 double_crochet in the same space double_crochet 5 times in the next ch1 space double_crochet in the next ch1 space chain 1 double_crochet in the same space alternate each double_crochet cluster with a v in the next space when you get to the end of the row skip the last ch1 space and double_crochet one time in the chain 3 post ch3 and turn your work row 3 because this is an odd row we will not do any double_crochet clusters and we will only do vs we will also be decreasing at the beginning and end of this row so skip the first ch1 space then in the clusters double_crochet in the 3rd double_crochet of the next double_crochet cluster ch1 and double_crochet again in the same stitch in ch1 spaces double_crochet in the next ch1 space ch1 then double_crochet in the same space at the end of the row skip the last ch1 space or cluster instead double_crochet once in the ch3 post repeat instructions for row 2 and 3 once each to have 5 row don t cut your yarn yet for row 7 we will single_crochet in every stitch around the arm hole once again repeat the entire sleeve on the other side neckline make a slip knot on your hook count 3 row up from the bottom of your triangles here insert your hook into both sides of the neckline at the top of the 3rd row single_crochet twice to join these stitches don t cut your yarn yet chain 2 and half_double_crochet along the neckline until you get to the back of the neckline then single_crochet along
